content: antonio s autumn cloche antonio s autumn cloche is the third of the seasonal hats in the four seasons collection it is widely believed that antonio vivaldi s inspiration for the four seasons stems from the time he spent as the court chapel master in the gorgeous countryside of mantua italy like its companion vivaldi autumn mitts this cloche brings to mind vibrant leaves turned ocher sienna burgundy crimson and gold a sense of quiet as they flutter and fall and the earth settles into a season of stillness please do not copy distribute or sell this pattern in any form © grace anne knits 2025 size fits an average teen/adult head 20-24 inches/50-60 cm gauge 6 stitches per inch on us 4 in stockinette in the round *see blocking notes materials dk/light worsted yarn 150 -200 yards us 4 3 5mm circular needle or double point needles notions 6 locking stitch markers 1 unique stitch marker and a tapestry needle to weave in ends abbreviations k - knit k1tbl - knit 1 through the back loop k2tog - knit 2 together k3tog - knit 3 together p - purl pm - place marker rm remove marker s sk2p slip next st knitwise knit 2 together pass slipped stitch over st s stitch es yo - yarn over gracianne designs this pattern is for private use only it may not be copied sold or otherwise distributed you also cannot sell any items produced in accordance with the instructions contained in this pattern without first contacting the author of the pattern 1 cast on 132 stitches using the long tail or stretchy cast on of your choice clip a locking stitch marker to the 2nd 25th 50th 75th 100th 125th cast on stitch the cast on stitches will be picked up and knit with live stitches when joining the hem place a unique stitch marker and prepare to work in the round folded picot hem round 1-12 k picot fold line round 13 * k2tog yo repeat * to end of round round 14 k1 p1 round 15-25 k1tbl p1 11 rounds weave in the cast on tail fold and pin the hem fold the hem purl side in on the picot fold line without unclipping the stitch markers on the cast on edge pin the hem in place by also clipping the markers to the corresponding live stitch on the needle 2nd 25th 50th 75th 100th 125th this will keep the hem from twisting and puckering as you join the cast on edge to the live stitches join the hem knit 1 then with right needle pick up the 2nd stitch from the cast on edge and without twisting it place it on the left needle remove marker knit that stitch together with the next live stitch on the needle repeat knitting every other cast on stitch together with the next live stitch on the needle to end of round removing markers as above set up round k3 k2tog *
